messages.message: Shall we juggernaut this bastard?
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Shall we juggernaut this bastard?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. The term "juggernaut" suggests a willingness to engage in a joint attack with a specific target in mind, indicating a proactive approach and potential interest in forming a strong alliance with you to pursue common strategic goals.

messages.message: you'll have to define 'juggernaut' and 'this bastard'
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'you'll have to define 'juggernaut' and 'this bastard''.

messages.message: Basically just "Hey, you wanna work together?"
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Basically just "Hey, you wanna work together?"'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's simplified explanation of "juggernaut" as a collaborative effort to work together with you indicates a straightforward and transparent approach, showing an initial interest in cooperation and setting a foundation for open communication and potential alliance-building.

messages.message: I'll certainly consider it. Do you have any specific requests in mind regarding the Balkans and Black Sea?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I'll certainly consider it. Do you have any specific requests in mind regarding the Balkans and Black Sea?'.

messages.message: I'd rather we didn't bounce in the black sea - If you move your fleet to Constantinople then you can get it out into the Mediterranean really quickly, to both of our benefits.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'I'd rather we didn't bounce in the black sea - If you move your fleet to Constantinople then you can get it out into the Mediterranean really quickly, to both of our benefits.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's suggestion to avoid bouncing in the Black Sea and proposing a strategic move for mutual benefit demonstrates a willingness to collaborate and engage in constructive dialogue, indicating a proactive approach towards building a positive relationship and working towards shared goals.

messages.message: I'm not sure I know you well enough yet to just hand you the black sea, though. What's in it for me?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I'm not sure I know you well enough yet to just hand you the black sea, though. What's in it for me?'.

messages.message: Rumania? I'll support you in.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Rumania? I'll support you in.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's offer to support you in capturing Rumania indicates a willingness to engage in a mutually beneficial agreement, showcasing a cooperative attitude and a concrete gesture towards building trust and strengthening the potential alliance between both powers.

messages.message: If you want me to have Rumania (and presumably you don't want to take any of my holdings), what use is it to be in the Black sea anyway?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'If you want me to have Rumania (and presumably you don't want to take any of my holdings), what use is it to be in the Black sea anyway?'.

messages.message: I'm imagining your being in Rumania as a short-term trust-building sort of thing. You're in there for a year, maybe two tops, and you get builds from that that allow you to build more fleets to flood the Med, and I get the long-term comfort of not worrying about you going to BLA. Once we start picking up Italian/Austrian dots, we can trade Rumania back to me to keep some parity going.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'I'm imagining your being in Rumania as a short-term trust-building sort of thing. You're in there for a year, maybe two tops, and you get builds from that that allow you to build more fleets to flood the Med, and I get the long-term comfort of not worrying about you going to BLA. Once we start picking up Italian/Austrian dots, we can trade Rumania back to me to keep some parity going.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's strategic reasoning behind the proposal for TURKEY to be in Rumania as a trust-building measure and the offer for a potential future exchange demonstrates a forward-thinking and cooperative approach, highlighting a long-term perspective and a desire to establish a stable and mutually beneficial relationship, thereby indicating a genuine interest in collaboration.

messages.message: I'm tentatively on board with this agreement but I will let you know definitively when I've heard back from our pastry and opera loving neighbor
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I'm tentatively on board with this agreement but I will let you know definitively when I've heard back from our pastry and opera loving neighbor'.

messages.message: Sounds good.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Sounds good.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's concise response of "Sounds good" indicates a positive acknowledgment of the tentative agreement and a readiness to proceed with the plan, reflecting an optimistic attitude and a willingness to continue the diplomatic discussions with a cooperative approach.

messages.message: Have you spoken to Austria at all? If so, what have you told them?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Have you spoken to Austria at all? If so, what have you told them?'.

messages.message: Told Austria I was gonna be working with them to dig you out, was lying through my teeth.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Told Austria I was gonna be working with them to dig you out, was lying through my teeth.'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. RUSSIA's admission of deceiving Austria about collaborating with them to target TURKEY indicates a willingness to manipulate and mislead other players, suggesting a potentially untrustworthy and duplicitous approach in diplomatic interactions. It is essential to be cautious and consider the implications of RUSSIA's deceptive behavior in future dealings.

messages.message: well how can I be sure you aren't lying to me, rather than them? Did you make any specific promises to them?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'well how can I be sure you aren't lying to me, rather than them? Did you make any specific promises to them?'.

messages.message: ...well I know I didn't formally agree, but I hope you can see from my leaving the black sea open for you that I do see the value in us working together.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'...well I know I didn't formally agree, but I hope you can see from my leaving the black sea open for you that I do see the value in us working together.'.

messages.message: ...don't you think it's a little early in the game to cut off communication entirely?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'...don't you think it's a little early in the game to cut off communication entirely?'.

messages.message: Sorry about that, busy morning/afternoon at work.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Sorry about that, busy morning/afternoon at work.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's apology for a lapse in communication due to a busy schedule reflects a reasonable explanation for any delays or interruptions, indicating a genuine attempt to maintain open lines of communication and a willingness to engage in diplomatic discussions despite potential constraints.

messages.message: I think we're well set up for the future.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'I think we're well set up for the future.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's positive outlook on the current situation and expressing confidence about the future suggests a sense of optimism and stability in the alliance, indicating a belief in the strength of the collaboration and a strategic vision for the upcoming phases of the game.

messages.message:
I'd like to think so, too. Would you still be willing to support me into Rum this turn?

I haven't heard anything from Austria and that worries me...have you?
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'I'd like to think so, too. Would you still be willing to support me into Rum this turn?

I haven't heard anything from Austria and that worries me...have you?'.

messages.message: I haven't heart squat from Austria. Quite worried. And yeah, you've got my support into Rum.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'I haven't heart squat from Austria. Quite worried. And yeah, you've got my support into Rum.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's confirmation of offering support into Rumania and expressing concern about the lack of communication from Austria shows a willingness to collaborate and address potential strategic challenges together, indicating a proactive attitude towards reinforcing the alliance and adapting to the evolving dynamics of the game.

messages.message: if your priority for our alliance is 'flooding the mediterranean', then it would benefit us both for me to have two builds this turn. Would you be willing to support Con-Bul as well as Bul-Rum?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'if your priority for our alliance is 'flooding the mediterranean', then it would benefit us both for me to have two builds this turn. Would you be willing to support Con-Bul as well as Bul-Rum?'.

messages.message: Yeah, good call. So ordered.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Yeah, good call. So ordered.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's agreement to support both Con-Bul and Bul-Rum moves aligns with the shared goal of strengthening the alliance and expanding influence in the Mediterranean, indicating a cooperative approach and a commitment to fulfilling mutually beneficial strategies, thereby demonstrating a willingness to work together towards common objectives.
